head.title: email : Webview : RPS Direct - Monday, April 13, 2020

meta.content: COVID-19 Update www.rvaschools.net Monday, April 13, 2020 Dear #RPSStrong Family, Fortunately, it appears that the worst of today's weather has passed. But winds are still gusting across the region so please be careful! Before diving in, a quick housekeeping note: In an effort to streamline these messages a bit, I've created a new section at the bottom called Important Links to replace some of the other sections that were getting quite long. Please let me know if there's a link you feel I should add to the list. Thanks! Today's updates: Exceptional Education - Please see below for some exciting exceptional education updates. The EdPlan Connect Parent Portal launched today! This portal will allow parents/caregivers to review and sign Individualized Education Programs (IEPs) as well as eligibility documentation. It will automatically generate a message to the email address on record every time there's a new document that requires your review and signature. You can also log in at any time to review your child's documents. To learn more about the portal, click here. Tutoring is now available for students with IEPs. To register, click here. Please visit the exceptional education section of RPS@Home to learn about other supports! Edgenuity Modules
meta.name: description

meta.content: COVID-19 Update www.rvaschools.net Monday, April 13, 2020 Dear #RPSStrong Family, Fortunately, it appears that the worst of today's weather has passed. But winds are still gusting across the region so please be careful! Before diving in, a quick housekeeping note: In an effort to streamline these messages a bit, I've created a new section at the bottom called Important Links to replace some of the other sections that were getting quite long. Please let me know if there's a link you feel I should add to the list. Thanks! Today's updates: Exceptional Education - Please see below for some exciting exceptional education updates. The EdPlan Connect Parent Portal launched today! This portal will allow parents/caregivers to review and sign Individualized Education Programs (IEPs) as well as eligibility documentation. It will automatically generate a message to the email address on record every time there's a new document that requires your review and signature. You can also log in at any time to review your child's documents. To learn more about the portal, click here. Tutoring is now available for students with IEPs. To register, click here. Please visit the exceptional education section of RPS@Home to learn about other supports! Edgenuity Modules

Please let me know if there's a link you feel I should add to the list. Thanks!

span.span: - Please see below for some exciting exceptional education updates.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: The EdPlan Connect Parent Portal launched today! This portal will allow parents/caregivers to review and sign Individualized Education Programs (IEPs) as well as eligibility documentation. It will automatically generate a message to the email address on record every time there's a new document that requires your review and signature. You can also log in at any time to review your child's documents. To learn more about the portal, click here.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Tutoring is now available for students with IEPs. To register, click here.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Please visit the exceptional education section of RPS@Home to learn about other supports!

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: Edgenuity Modules on RPS@Home – It looks like there was a glitch with some of the high school English modules. Edgenuity is working on it and they should have things ironed out soon. Thanks for your patience!

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: Marking Period 3 (MP3) and Final Grades - I recently shared how we're going to approach MP3 and final grades. See below for answers to several questions that we've received since.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: What is the deadline for teachers to finalize MP3 grades? May 8.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: In finalizing MP3 grades, should teachers consider work done after March 13? No, only work completed before we closed.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: At the elementary level, when should an “S” (Successful) be used and when should an “N” (Needs Improvement) be used? Grades of A - D should be coded as “S," while a failing grade should be coded as “N." Teachers are encouraged to include comments for any "N" notation.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: At the elementary level, should teachers complete the SOL profiles and reading level? Yes, to the extent possible, based on the first six weeks of MP3.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: At the middle and high school level, will ASPEN automatically enter an "E" (Exempt) for missing assignments, as well as raise failing grades to 50%? No, teachers will unfortunately need to make these changes manually.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: If a course included a midterm exam, how should it be handled for MP3? A midterm exam should only be included if it benefits a student's MP3 grade.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Will report cards be distributed for MP3? No, report cards will be distributed at the end of the school year. That said, to the extent possible, teachers are encouraged to contact the parents/caregivers of students who receive an “N” at the elementary level or a failing grade at the secondary level.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: As always, if you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact me at jkamras@rvaschools.net.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: Please keep sending them to me at jkamras@rvaschools.net!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: A big shout out goes to our teachers and coaches that stepped up to help roll out Week 1 of RPS@Home! These outstanding educators curated lessons and resources, and recorded themselves for the world to see on YouTube. Thank you! Tiana Addai-Mensah, Shawn Weisser, Laura Gonzalez-Armstrong, Michelle Gelrud, AzurDe Greenhill, Melinda Lawson, Danielle Rodgers, Bonnie Green, Linda Shapanka, Lindsay Beekman, Keith Browne, Lisa Perkinson, Desiree Dabney, Richard Rebmann, Rebecca Ceja, Keri Lagow, Charlotte Lucus, Jamie Blare-Walker, Justin White, Desiree Cotten, Monica Thomas Moore, Ashley Wolfe, Kristen Ruddy, Chele Williams, Sebrina Davis, Linda Jaeger, Meghan Manley, Rachel Smith, Shaunte Means, Ashley Allen, Carmen Brown, Tiwori Bibby.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Ms. Hartman, first grade teacher at J.L. Francis, spent her Spring Break applying for and receiving $1,000 from the Keep Kids Learning Program offered through Donors Choose!!! She is sending students differentiated learning supplies based on the need of the student and family. WOAH!!!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: My granddaughter is in kindergarten at John B. Cary. It has been a real blessing to me and her mother to have the daily lessons available. Thank you so much for putting these online. They are very well done, interesting, and so helpful to me and my daughter. Whoever came up with the idea and organized it deserves a round of applause. I am so proud of RPS!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Mr. Walker, assistant principal at Binford Middle School, took the time to call and check in on my student and told us to reach out if we needed anything. Shows that they care about their students.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Ms. Zernet is an English learner teacher at Miles Jones. She has been very helpful to me and my grandson. Thank god for her because we speak French and we needed help right now.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to give a "shout out" to Mrs. Lisa Williams, AP at Broad Rock Elementary. She has been constantly checking in on the students and staff and is always willing to lend a hand or hug (even if virtual). She is such an asset to BRES & we LOVE her!! Thanks for all you do, Mrs. Williams!!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Shout out to Mr. Barclay, math teacher at Franklin Military, for holding classes daily on Zoom. Also shout out to Colonel Hudson, Principal of Franklin Military, for being available to students and parents for any and everything, and keeping the Franklin Military family updated with all new information.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: We really appreciate all that the teachers are doing to provide us with such an easily navigated, challenging, and interesting curriculum for the rest of the school year. We realize that everything you all are doing, including the meals program, is way above and beyond what anyone might have expected on such short order. My daughter (2nd Grade, Fox Elementary) was beginning to worry after the first week when I was teaching her colonial American history, a little Western Civilization, Biology, Geometry, and anything else I could find on You Tube, or in my old textbook collection. She has really enjoyed "meeting" some of the teachers from the other schools...It has made both of us feel a part of a much larger community...No specific shout-outs, just one big one to everyone who is helping to make one of our most essential services so much more personal and doable.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Ms. Moore from Westover Hills ES called to check on our whole family. I was reminded that talking to her is like talking to a friend. We also want to shout to Ms. El Koubi and her son. Their reading everyday is a highlight of our daily routine. Keep up the great work, all!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Shout out to Ms. Sales, from Broad Rock Elementary, who reaches out weekly to check on my 1st grader. Even if we miss the call, I have to play the voicemail for him or he’s gonna keep asking if she called. Thank you, Ms. Sales!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Many thanks to Mr. Dremon Miller, my child's Richmond Technical Center teacher, who stopped by today to bless her with an "off to college" basket, complete with iron, clothes hangers, shower slides, clothes basket, and many other items she can use at VSU. Mr. Miller has done a great job checking on her weekly. His surprise today made me realize how great RTC Teachers really are!

span.span: – Today's celebrity reader is Rodney Robinson, our very own 2019 National Teacher of the Year! Thank you, Mr. Robinson, for taking the time to do this! To see all the other celebrity readers, just click here.

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif
span.span: "Mr. K's 30 Minutes of Math!"– Check out my math lessons at 2 pm every weekdays. I'm focusing on fractions, but every lesson also includes a Math Joke of the Day and a Math Riddle of the Day (see below). You can also view past episodes here.
